bug.author: vishalsantv
bug.summary: NameSpace kubeflow hardcoded resulting in DNS issues ?
bug.description:
brew install ksonnet/tap/ks curl -L -o kubeflow.tar.gz https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/download/v0.5.0/kfctl_v0.5.0_darwin.tar.gz tar -xzvf kubeflow.tar.gz ./kfctl init ks-app --version v0.5.0 --namespace kube-flow cd ks-app/ ../kfctl generate k8s cd ks_app/ ks show default > all.yaml Create a namespace kube-flow ( instead of kubeflow ) and create a kubeflow installation on an on prem k8s cluster using all.yaml
Navigate to pipelines tab This step is in Error state with this message: failed to save outputs: Get http://minio-service.kubeflow:9000/mlpipeline/?location=: dial tcp: lookup minio-service.kubeflow on 172.17.0.10:53: no such host of course this is the minio-service Name: minio-service Namespace: kube-flow Labels: ksonnet.io/component=pipeline Annotations: <none> Selector: app=minio Type: ClusterIP IP: 172.17.10.244 Port: <unset> 9000/TCP TargetPort: 9000/TCP Endpoints: 10.246.219.68:9000 Session Affinity: None Events: <none> It seems that there is some hardcoded dependency on kubeflow namespace.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

I tried the same deployment test and replace the namespace kube-flow. No namespace state problem in my environment. <denchmark-code>$ kubectl -n kube-flow get pod NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE ambassador-66796d5dd-8l5tw 1/1 Running 0 16m ambassador-66796d5dd-9lp2m 1/1 Running 0 16m ambassador-66796d5dd-zxcz8 1/1 Running 0 16m argo-ui-6b54b7db79-p2fcq 1/1 Running 0 16m centraldashboard-5c5c754f45-7tw6n 1/1 Running 0 16m jupyter-web-app-847f4f465c-bb7tc 1/1 Running 0 16m katib-ui-7dfcdb675d-5phj6 1/1 Running 0 16m metacontroller-0 1/1 Running 0 16m minio-66f77db99-4x89k 1/1 Running 0 16m ml-pipeline-dc5569cf9-sp5xc 1/1 Running 0 16m ml-pipeline-persistenceagent-57f46f4b88-rxs52 1/1 Running 0 16m ml-pipeline-scheduledworkflow-58c969c7d6-q285l 1/1 Running 0 16m ml-pipeline-ui-6b5bb47fd8-q6ntf 1/1 Running 0 16m ml-pipeline-viewer-controller-deployment-7c5c47f4f6-vh9q5 1/1 Running 0 16m mysql-6f6b5f7b64-l94tt 1/1 Running 0 16m notebooks-controller-7855b954c7-5d9b9 1/1 Running 0 16m pytorch-operator-864497777f-gfnxg 1/1 Running 0 16m studyjob-controller-65bc99b4df-t8bbn 1/1 Running 0 16m tensorboard-655645ff67-559cf 1/1 Running 0 16m tf-job-dashboard-ffd74f79-zfmtm 1/1 Running 0 16m tf-job-operator-d979d98dd-t2flr 1/1 Running 0 16m vizier-core-7f7f765d56-vtgg7 1/1 Running 0 16m vizier-core-rest-69b5bcdcd-82zwz 1/1 Running 0 16m vizier-db-777675b958-6k79w 1/1 Running 0 16m vizier-suggestion-bayesianoptimization-775796f878-q8td4 1/1 Running 0 16m vizier-suggestion-grid-859b677564-bbkbd 1/1 Running 0 16m vizier-suggestion-hyperband-5768f5db4d-zjs7b 1/1 Running 0 16m vizier-suggestion-random-794f6c5858-4tzmz 1/1 Running 0 16m workflow-controller-5c95f95f58-2qfxj 1/1 Running 0 16m </denchmark-code>
You should check your environment and remove old deployments.
Deployments was not an issue. Did you try launching a pipeline ?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
